org.microbean.settings

Class Converters

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microbean.settings.Converters
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConverterProvider

    public final class Converters
extends Object
implements ConverterProvider
    A hub for the centralized conversion of Values.

    Converters instances compute Converters on demand in many cases and are normally used in standalone environments.

    Author:
    Laird Nelson

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> T convert(Value value, Class<T> type)
      Converts the supplied Value to an object of the proper type and returns the result of the conversion using a Converter previously installed under a Type equal to the supplied Class.

      • Converters

        public Converters(Collection<? extends Converter<?>> converters)
        Creates a new Converters instance.
        Parameters:
        converters - a Collection of Converters that will be installed into this Converters instance; may be null
        Throws:
        ConcurrentModificationException - if some other thread modifies the supplied Collection while iteration is in progress

    • Method Detail

      • getConverter

        public final <T> Converter<? extends T> getConverter(TypeLiteral<T> type)
        Returns a Converter capable of converting Values into objects of the supplied type.
        Specified by:
        getConverter in interface ConverterProvider
        Type Parameters:
        T - the conversion type
        Parameters:
        type - a TypeLiteral describing the conversion type; must not be null
        Returns:
        a non-null Converter capable of converting Values into objects of the proper type
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if type is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if no Converter is available for the supplied type
        See Also:
        ConverterProvider.getConverter(Type)
        Idempotency:
        Because Converters can be added to this Converters instance, this method may return different Converter instances over time given the same type.
        Nullability:
        This method never returns null.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • putConverter

        public final <T> Converter<? extends T> putConverter(Class<T> type,
                                                     Converter<? extends T> converter)
        Installs the supplied Converter under the supplied Class and returns any Converter previously installed under a Type equal to that Class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the conversion type
        Parameters:
        type - the Class describing the conversion type of the supplied Converter; must not be null
        converter - the Converter to install; must not be null
        Returns:
        the Converter previously installed under a Type equal to the supplied Class, or null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if type or converter is null
        See Also:
        getConverter(Class)
        Idempotency:
        This method is not idempotent.
        Nullability:
        This method may return null.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • putConverter

        public final <T> Converter<? extends T> putConverter(TypeLiteral<T> type,
                                                     Converter<? extends T> converter)
        Installs the supplied Converter under the supplied TypeLiteral's Type and returns any Converter previously installed under a Type equal to that Type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the conversion type
        Parameters:
        type - the TypeLiteral describing the conversion type of the supplied Converter; must not be null
        converter - the Converter to install; must not be null
        Returns:
        the Converter previously installed under a Type equal to the supplied TypeLiteral's Type, or null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if type or converter is null
        See Also:
        getConverter(TypeLiteral)
        Idempotency:
        This method is not idempotent.
        Nullability:
        This method may return null.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • removeConverter

        public final <T> Converter<? extends T> removeConverter(Class<T> key)
        Uninstalls and returns any Converter stored under a key equal to the supplied key.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the conversion type
        Parameters:
        key - the key designating the Converter to remove; must not be null
        Returns:
        the Converter that was uninstalled, or null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if key is null
        Idempotency:
        This method will uninstall and return any Converter stored under a key equal to the supplied key, and, if then invoked with the same key, will return null thereafter.
        Nullability:
        This method may return null.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • convert

        public final <T> T convert(Value value,
                           Class<T> type)
        Converts the supplied Value to an object of the proper type and returns the result of the conversion using a Converter previously installed under a Type equal to the supplied Class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the conversion type
        Parameters:
        value - the Value to convert; may be null
        type - the Class designating the Converter to use; must not be null
        Returns:
        the result of the conversion, which may be null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if type is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if conversion fails because of a problem with the supplied Value
        ConversionException - if conversion fails for any other reason
        Idempotency:
        This method may return different results when supplied with the same parameter values over repeated invocations.
        Nullability:
        This method may return null.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • convert

        public final <T> T convert(Value value,
                           TypeLiteral<T> type)
        Converts the supplied Value to an object of the proper type and returns the result of the conversion using a Converter previously installed under a Type equal to the supplied TypeLiteral's Type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the conversion type
        Parameters:
        value - the Value to convert; may be null
        type - the TypeLiteral designating the Converter to use; must not be null
        Returns:
        the result of the conversion, which may be null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if type is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if conversion fails because of a problem with the supplied Value
        ConversionException - if conversion fails for any other reason
        Idempotency:
        This method may return different results when supplied with the same parameter values over repeated invocations.
        Nullability:
        This method may return null.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
